register.name: ADFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Data Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes.

register.name: AIFSR
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED fault status information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to EL1 modes.

register.name: DFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception.

register.name: DFSR
register.description: Holds status information about the last data fault.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort.

bitField.name: CM
bitField.description: Cache maintenance fault. For synchronous faults, this bit indicates whether a cache maintenance instruction generated the fault.

bitField.name: ExT
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can be used to provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of external aborts.

bitField.name: WnR
bitField.description: Write not Read bit. Indicates whether the abort was caused by a write or a read instruction.

register.name: HADFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Data Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Data Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HAIFSR
register.gui_name: Hyp Auxiliary Instruction Fault Status Register
register.description: Provides additional IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED syndrome information for Prefetch Abort exceptions taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HDFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Data Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HIFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Prefetch Abort exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: HPFAR
register.description: Holds the faulting IPA for some aborts on a stage 2 translation taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: FIPA_39_12
bitField.description: Bits [39:12] of the faulting intermediate physical address.

register.name: HSR
register.description: Holds syndrome information for an exception taken to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: EC
bitField.description: Exception Class. Indicates the reason for the exception that this register holds information about.

bitField.name: IL
bitField.description: Instruction length bit. Indicates the size of the instruction that has been trapped to Hyp mode.

bitField.name: ISS
bitField.description: Instruction Specific Syndrome. Architecturally, this field can be defined independently for each defined Exception class. However, in practice, some ISS encodings are used for more than one Exception class.

register.name: HVBAR
register.description: Holds the vector base address for any exception that is taken to Hyp mode.

register.name: IFAR
register.description: Holds the virtual address of the faulting address that caused a synchronous Prefetch Abort exception.

register.name: IFSR
register.description: Holds status information about the last instruction fault.

bitField.name: FnV
bitField.description: FAR not Valid, for a Synchronous external abort.

bitField.name: ExT
bitField.description: External abort type. This bit can be used to provide an IMPLEMENTATION DEFINED classification of external aborts.

register.name: ISR
register.description: Shows whether any IRQ, FIQ, or external abort is pending. In an implementation that includes EL2, when the register is accessed from Non-secure EL1, a pending interrupt might be a physical interrupt or a virtual interrupt, and the architecture does not provide any mechanism that software executing at Non-secure EL1 can use to determine whether a pending interrupt is physical or virtual. For all other accesses, any indicated interrupt must be a physical interrupt.

bitField.name: F
bitField.description: FIQ pending bit. Indicates whether an FIQ interrupt is pending.

register.name: VBAR
register.description: When high exception vectors are not selected, holds the vector base address for exceptions that are not taken to Monitor mode or to Hyp mode...

tcf:enumItem.description: DFAR is valid.
tcf:enumItem.name: DFAR_is_valid

tcf:enumItem.description: DFAR is not valid, and holds an UNKNOWN value.
tcf:enumItem.name: DFAR_is_not_valid_and_holds_an_UNKNOWN_value

tcf:enumItem.name: Data_Abort_taken_without_a_change_in_Exception_level

tcf:enumItem.name: _16_bit_instruction_trapped
